answers.answer: Hi there!Low blood iron is unlikely to be related to the diabetes and is likely to have a primary haematological cause such as rapid RBC destruction, decreased iron absorption etc. It would be best to discuss the situation, the suggested management plan and the expected prognosis in detail with her treating haematologist.Hope this is helpful.Take care!

question: my daughter is 32 yrs. old. she has had her left big toe cut off an her right toe scrape to the bone. she is a diabetes.,type ll.she is having a blood transfusion every week. whats going on. they say her iron is low, then aweek later after the transfion it low again.
title: blood transfusioa in dabetes
